sentences.sContent: Long after this, in a street in Bolpur, a mendicant Baul was singing as he walked along
sentences.sContent_eng: Long after this, in a street in Bolpur, a mendicant Baul was singing as he walked along
sentences.sCn: 很久以后，在鲍尔普尔的一条街上，一个行乞的歌手一面走一面唱

sentences.sContent: This dear little naked mendicant pretends to be utterly helpless, so that he may beg for mother's wealth of love.
sentences.sContent_eng: This dear little naked mendicant pretends to be utterly helpless, so that he may beg for mother's wealth of love.
sentences.sCn: 这个亲爱的赤裸的小小的乞儿，故意装做完全无助的样子，想要以此来乞求妈妈满溢的爱。

sentences.sContent: This man, in his attire, as in all his person, realized the type of what may be called the well-bred mendicant,--extreme wretchedness combined with extreme cleanliness.
sentences.sContent_eng: This man, in his attire, as in all his person, realized the type of what may be called the well-bred mendicant,--extreme wretchedness combined with extreme cleanliness.
sentences.sCn: 那人，从他的服装和神气看去，是极其穷苦而又极其整洁的，可以说是体现了人们称为高等乞丐的那一种。

remMethod.val: mend(修补， 改善) + icant → 生活需要改善的人 → 乞丐
